oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Deflation Based Krylov Subspace Methods for Sequences of Linear Systems
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Božović, Nemanja
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Many problems in engineering, numerical simulations in physics etc. require the solution of long sequences of slowly changing linear systems. As an alternative to GCRO-DR and Loose GCRO-DR, we propose two algorithms, LRDGMRES and Loose LRDGMRES, that use an oblique projection in the spirit of truly deflated GMRES for deflating the eigenvalues of smallest magnitude. This oblique projection requires approximations to right and left eigenvectors, and we proposed a way of getting the approximations to the left eigenvectors, without having to build a Krylov subspace with respect to A^H, which saves a lot of work.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: 500 Naturwissenschaften und Mathematik » 510 Mathematik
Fakultät für Mathematik und Naturwissenschaften » Mathematik und Informatik » Dissertationen
